algorithm_technique: Iterative DFS using a stack with state management
problem_summary_simple: Create an exact copy of an N-ary tree, preserving structure and values.
problem_summary_technical: Deep copy an N-ary tree. Solutions involve iterative or recursive DFS, managing node creation and child connections.
key_insights: The iterative solution uses a stack to simulate recursion, managing states to build the new tree.
Reversing children before pushing onto the stack ensures correct order in the cloned tree.
Recursive DFS naturally traverses and builds the cloned tree by creating new nodes and linking children.
Base case for recursion is a null node, returning None.
